description: Least positive integer k for which 5^n divides k!.
comments: Also the smallest factorial having n trailing zeros. - _Jud McCranie_, Oct 05 2010
references: H. Ibstedt, Smarandache Primitive Numbers, Smarandache Notions Journal, Vol. 8, No. 1-2-3, 1997, 216-229.
links: T. D. Noe, Table of n, a(n) for n=0..1000
mathematica: lpi[n_]:=Module[{k=1,n5=5^n},While[!Divisible[k!,n5],k++];k]; Array[ lpi,60,0] (* _Harvey P. Dale_, Jun 19 2012 *)CoefficientList[Series[(1 + (5 x)/(x - 1)^2), {x, 0, 50}], x] - (* _Benedict W. J. Irwin_, Feb 09 2016 *)
prog: (PARI) a(n) = {k = 1; while (valuation(k!, 5) < n, k++); k;} \\ _Michel Marcus_, Aug 19 2013
author: Bruce Dearden and _Jerry Metzger_
